ComputedFieldTypes.jl

    Docstrings
    ComputedFieldTypes.@computed — Macro.
    @computed type

    Allows declaration of a type expression where some of the fields types are arbitrary computed functions of other type parameters. It's suggested that those expressions be const (return the same value for the same inputs), but that is not essential.

    ComputedFieldTypes.ComputedFieldTypes
    ComputedFieldTypes._computed — Function.
    _computed(typeexpr::Expr)

    the bulk of the work to compute the AST transform

    ComputedFieldTypes.eval
    ComputedFieldTypes.fulltype — Function.
    fulltype(::Type)

    Fill in the computed type parameters for T (if applicable and possible)

    ComputedFieldTypes.getenv! — Function.
    getenv!(expr, tvars, defs)

    replace anything that isn't computable by apply_type with a dummy type-variable

    ComputedFieldTypes.include
    ComputedFieldTypes.make_Type_expr — Function.
    make_Type_expr(tname, decl_tvars)

    make the ::Type{T} expression that is equivalent to the original type declaration

    ComputedFieldTypes.make_curly — Function.
    make_curly(expr)

    given an apply-type expression (T or T{...}), return Expr(:curly, T, ...)

    ComputedFieldTypes.make_fulltype_expr — Function.
    make_fulltype_expr(tname, decl_tvars, def)

    compute the leaf T{def} expression that is equivalent for the new type declaration

    ComputedFieldTypes.make_new_expr — Function.
    make_new_expr(tname, decl_tvars, def)

    compute the leaf T{...} expression that describes the new type declaration

    ComputedFieldTypes.rewrite_new! — Function.
    rewrite_new!(expr, tname::Symbol, decl_tvars, def)

    rewrite the constructors to capture only the intended values
